data.text:
Colonel Nikolai Aleksandrovich Kulikovsky1

M, #102201, b. 5 November 1881, d. 11 August 1958

Last Edited=10 Nov 2002

Colonel Nikolai Aleksandrovich Kulikovsky was born on 5 November 1881. He married Olga Aleksandrovna Romanov, Grand Duchess of Russia, daughter of Aleksandr III Aleksandrovich Romanov, Tsar of Russia and Marie Sophie Frederikke Dagmar zu Schleswig-Holstein-Sonderburg-Gl√ºcksburg, Princess of Denmark, on 1 November 1916. He died on 11 August 1958 at age 76 at Cooksville, Ontario, Canada . He was buried at York Cemetery, Toronto, Ontario, Canada .

Children of Colonel Nikolai Aleksandrovich Kulikovsky and Olga Aleksandrovna Romanov, Grand Duchess of Russia

Tikhon Kulikovsky+ b. 25 Aug 1917, d. 9 Apr 1993

Gouri Kulikovsky+ b. 23 Apr 1919, d. Sep 1984

Citations

[S12] C. Arnold McNaughton, The Book of Kings: A Royal Genealogy, in 3 volumes (London, U.K.: Garnstone Press, 1973), volume 1, page 216. Hereinafter cited as The Book of Kings.

Tikhon Kulikovsky

M, #102202, b. 25 August 1917, d. 9 April 1993

Last Edited=15 Feb 2011

Tikhon Kulikovsky was born on 25 August 1917 at Ai-Todor, Crimea, Russia . He was the son of Colonel Nikolai Aleksandrovich Kulikovsky and Olga Aleksandrovna Romanov, Grand Duchess of Russia. He married, firstly, Agnete Parersen in 1942 at Copenhagen, Denmark . He and Agnete Parersen were divorced in 1955. He married, secondly, Livia Sebesteyn on 21 September 1959 at Toronto, Ontario, Canada . He married, thirdly, Olga Pupynin Burton on 8 June 1986 at Toronto, Ontario, Canada . He died on 9 April 1993 at age 75 at Toronto, Ontario, Canada .

Child of Tikhon Kulikovsky and Livia Sebesteyn

Olga Kulikovsky+ b. 9 Jan 1964

Gouri Kulikovsky

M, #102203, b. 23 April 1919, d. September 1984

Last Edited=1 Jun 2009

Gouri Kulikovsky was born on 23 April 1919. He was the son of Colonel Nikolai Aleksandrovich Kulikovsky and Olga Aleksandrovna Romanov, Grand Duchess of Russia. He married Ruth Schwartz on 5 October 1940 at Copenhagen, Denmark . He and Ruth Schwartz were divorced in 1956. He died in September 1984 at age 65 at Brockville, Ontario, Canada .

Children of Gouri Kulikovsky and Ruth Schwartz

Xenia Kulikovsky+ b. 19 Jun 1941

Leonid Kulikovsky b. 2 May 1943, d. 27 Sep 2015

Alexander Kulikovsky b. 29 Nov 1948

Andrei Aleksandrovich Romanov, Prince of Russia1

M, #102204, b. 24 January 1897, d. 8 May 1981

Last Edited=27 May 2003

Consanguinity Index=5.76%

Andrei Aleksandrovich Romanov, Prince of Russia was born on 24 January 1897 [12 Jan 1897 O.S.] at St. Petersburg, Russia .2 He was the son of Aleksandr Mikhailovich Romanov, Grand Duke of Russia and Xenia Aleksandrovna Romanov, Grand Duchess of Russia. He married, firstly, Donna Elizabeta Fabrizievna Sasso-Ruffo, Duchesa di Sasso-Ruffo, daughter of Don Fabrizio Sasso-Ruffo, Duca di Sasso-Ruffo and Princess Nataliya Aleksandrovna Mestcherskaya, on 12 June 1918 at Yalta, Crimea, Russia .2 He married, secondly, Nadine Sylvia Ada McDougall, daughter of Lt.-Col. Herbert McDougall, on 21 September 1942.3 He died on 8 May 1981 at age 84.

He gained the title of Prince Andrei of Russia.1

Child of Andrei Aleksandrovich Romanov, Prince of Russia and Nadine Sylvia Ada McDougall

Olga Romanoff, Princess Romanova+3 b. 8 Apr 1950

Citations

[S12] C. Arnold McNaughton, The Book of Kings: A Royal Genealogy, in 3 volumes (London, U.K.: Garnstone Press, 1973), volume 1, page 323. Hereinafter cited as The Book of Kings.

[S12] C. Arnold McNaughton, The Book of Kings, volume 1, page 324.

[S12] C. Arnold McNaughton, The Book of Kings, volume 1, page 325.

Feodor Aleksandrovich Romanov, Prince of Russia1

M, #102205, b. 23 December 1898, d. 30 November 1968

Last Edited=27 May 2003

Consanguinity Index=5.76%

Feodor Aleksandrovich Romanov, Prince of Russia was born on 23 December 1898 [11 Dec 1898 O.S.] at St. Petersburg, Russia .2 He was the son of Aleksandr Mikhailovich Romanov, Grand Duke of Russia and Xenia Aleksandrovna Romanov, Grand Duchess of Russia. He married Irina Pavlovna Romanovskya-Paley, Princess Paley, daughter of Pavel Aleksandrovich Romanov, Grand Duke of Russia and Olga Valerianovna Karnovich, on 31 May 1923 at Paris, France .2 He and Irina Pavlovna Romanovskya-Paley, Princess Paley were divorced on 22 July 1936.2 He was also reported to have been married on 31 March 1923 at Paris, France . He died on 30 November 1968 at age 69 at Ascain, France .2 He was also reported to have died on 1 December 1968.

He gained the title of Prince Feodor of Russia.1

Child of Feodor Aleksandrovich Romanov, Prince of Russia and Irina Pavlovna Romanovskya-Paley, Princess Paley

Mikhail Feodorovich Romanov, Prince Romanov+2 b. 4 May 1924

Citations

[S12] C. Arnold McNaughton, The Book of Kings: A Royal Genealogy, in 3 volumes (London, U.K.: Garnstone Press, 1973), volume 1, page 323. Hereinafter cited as The Book of Kings.

[S12] C. Arnold McNaughton, The Book of Kings, volume 1, page 327.

Nikita Aleksandrovich Romanov, Prince of Russia1

M, #102206, b. 17 January 1900, d. 12 September 1974

Last Edited=4 Nov 2017

Consanguinity Index=5.76%

Prince Nikita of Russia 2

Nikita Aleksandrovich Romanov, Prince of Russia was born on 17 January 1900 at St. Petersburg, Russia .3 He was the son of Aleksandr Mikhailovich Romanov, Grand Duke of Russia and Xenia Aleksandrovna Romanov, Grand Duchess of Russia. He married grafinya Mariya Ilarianovna Vorontzova-Dashkova,, daughter of graf Ilarion Ilarionovich Vorontzov-Dashkov and Irina Vassilievna Narishkina, on 19 February 1922 at Paris, France .3 He died on 12 September 1974 at age 74.

He gained the title of Prince Nikita of Russia.1

Children of Nikita Aleksandrovich Romanov, Prince of Russia and grafinya Mariya Ilarianovna Vorontzova-Dashkova,

Nikita Nikitich Romanov, Prince Romanov+4 b. 13 May 1923, d. 3 May 2007

Aleksandr Nikitich Romanov, Prince Romanov4 b. 4 Nov 1929, d. 21 Sep 2002

Citations

Dimitrii Aleksandrovich Romanov, Prince of Russia1

M, #102207, b. 15 August 1901, d. 7 July 1980

Last Edited=21 Jan 2014

Consanguinity Index=5.76%

Dimitrii Aleksandrovich Romanov, Prince of Russia was born on 15 August 1901 [2 Aug 1901 O.S.] at Gatchina Palace, St. Petersburg, Russia .2 He was the son of Aleksandr Mikhailovich Romanov, Grand Duke of Russia and Xenia Aleksandrovna Romanov, Grand Duchess of Russia. He married, firstly, Countess Marina Sergeievna Golenistcheva-Koutouzova, daughter of Count Sergei Aleksandrovich Golenistchev-Koutouzov and Mariya Besobrasova, on 25 October 1931 at Paris, France .2 He and Countess Marina Sergeievna Golenistcheva-Koutouzova were divorced in 1947.2 He married, secondly, Sheila Margaret MacKellar Chisholm, daughter of Harry Chisholm, on 20 October 1954 at London, England .3 He was also reported to have been married on 25 November 1931 at Paris, France . He was also reported to have been married on 29 October 1954 at London, England . He died on 7 July 1980 at age 78 at London, England .4

He gained the title of Prince Dimitrii of Russia.1

Child of Dimitrii Aleksandrovich Romanov, Prince of Russia and Countess Marina Sergeievna Golenistcheva-Koutouzova

Nadeshda Dimitriievna Romanov, Princess Romanov+5 b. 4 Jul 1933

Citations

[S12] C. Arnold McNaughton, The Book of Kings: A Royal Genealogy, in 3 volumes (London, U.K.: Garnstone Press, 1973), volume 1, page 323. Hereinafter cited as The Book of Kings.

Rostislav Aleksandrovich Romanov, Prince of Russia1

M, #102208, b. 23 December 1902, d. 31 July 1978

Last Edited=27 May 2003

Consanguinity Index=5.76%

Rostislav Aleksandrovich Romanov, Prince of Russia was born on 23 December 1902 at Ai-Todor, Crimea, Russia .2 He was also reported to have been born on 11 November 1902 at Ai-Todor, Crimea, Russia . He was the son of Aleksandr Mikhailovich Romanov, Grand Duke of Russia and Xenia Aleksandrovna Romanov, Grand Duchess of Russia. He married Countess Aleksandra Pavlovna Galitzine, daughter of Prince Pavel Pavlovich Galitzine and Princess Aleksandra Meshscherskaya, on 1 September 1928 at Chicago, Illinois, U.S.A. .1 He and Countess Aleksandra Pavlovna Galitzine were divorced in 1944 at Chicago, Illinois, U.S.A. .1 He married Alice Eilken, daughter of Alvin Eilken and Rose Schwartz, on 7 May 1945 at Chicago, Illinois, U.S.A. .1 He and Alice Eilken were divorced on 11 April 1951 at Chicago, Illinois, U.S.A. .2 He married Hedwig Maria Gertrud Eva von Chappuis, daughter of Karl von Chappuis and Gertrud Baronin von Richthofen, on 19 November 1954 at Chicago, Illinois, U.S.A. .2 He died on 31 July 1978 at age 75.

He gained the title of Prince Rostislav of Russia.1

Child of Rostislav Aleksandrovich Romanov, Prince of Russia and Countess Aleksandra Pavlovna Galitzine

Rostislav Rostislavich Romanov, Prince Romanov+3 b. 3 Dec 1938, d. 7 Jan 1999

Child of Rostislav Aleksandrovich Romanov, Prince of Russia and Alice Eilken

Nikolai Rostisalvich Romanov, Prince Romanov+3 b. 9 Sep 1945

Citations

Vassili Aleksandrovich Romanov, Prince of Russia1

M, #102209, b. 6 July 1907, d. 23 June 1989

Last Edited=27 May 2003

Consanguinity Index=5.76%

Vassili Aleksandrovich Romanov, Prince of Russia was born on 6 July 1907 [24 June 1907 O.S.] at Gatchina, Russia .2 He was the son of Aleksandr Mikhailovich Romanov, Grand Duke of Russia and Xenia Aleksandrovna Romanov, Grand Duchess of Russia. He married Princess Nataliya Aleksandrovna Galitzine, daughter of Prince Aleksandr Vladimirovich Galitzine and Ljobow Glebova, on 31 July 1931 at New York City, New York, U.S.A. .2 He died on 23 June 1989 at age 81 at Woodside, California, U.S.A. .

He gained the title of Prince Vassili of Russia.1

Child of Vassili Aleksandrovich Romanov, Prince of Russia and Princess Nataliya Aleksandrovna Galitzine

Marina Vassilievna Romanov, Princess Romanova+2 b. 22 May 1940

Citations

[S12] C. Arnold McNaughton, The Book of Kings: A Royal Genealogy, in 3 volumes (London, U.K.: Garnstone Press, 1973), volume 1, page 324. Hereinafter cited as The Book of Kings.
